poem:
Title: "Upon Reading of Sue Gray, Incognito Queen"

In stupefied silence, seekers gather,
Yearning for an audience, no less, with dignity's daughter.
Gray, the unnoticed, in plain sight's masquerade, 
Silhouetted by power's throne, quietly in the shade.
They pine for her favour, each political puppeteer, 
To whisper truths to a shadowed chancellor's ear.
The unsung melody of Labour's orchestration,
Sue Gray, the symbol of quiet domination.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. That woman is Sue Gray. Everyone wants to meet the power behind the throne. Gray was once a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
